programs.program_name: Bachelor of Chemical Engineering with Honours

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level: minimum passes in Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: at least Grade B in 5 subjects including Mathematics, Chemistry and Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: minimum Grade C (NGMP 2.00) in Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation: at least CGPA 2.0AND passes in Mathematics and Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.CPU: an average of 70% in 6 subjects including Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.IB Diploma: 32 points with 5 points in Mathematics Higher Level (HL) and 5 points in either Chemistry or Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.SACE/WACE: a TER 70 and Grade B in Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.

course_content.core: Physical and Organic Chemistry Chemical Engineering Drawing Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics Heat and Mass Transfer Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering Fluid Mechanics for Chemical Engineering Chemical Process Safety Reaction Engineering Process Synthesis and Simulation Chemical Process Technology and Design Organic Chemistry Process Control and Instrumentation Environmental Management Project Management and Economics Analytical Chemistry for Engineers Engineering Mathematics Numerical Methods in Engineering Research Methodology Engineers in Society Plant Equipment Design Introduction to Biochemical Engineering Material Science for Chemical Engineering Chemical Engineering Laboratory Research Project Capstone Project Engineering Statistics and Optimisation Project Management and Economics

A-Level.text: minimum passes in Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.

UEC.text: at least Grade B in 5 subjects including Mathematics, Chemistry and Physics.

STPM.text: minimum Grade C (NGMP 2.00) in Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.

Foundation.text: at least CGPA 2.0AND passes in Mathematics and Physics.

CPU.text: an average of 70% in 6 subjects including Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.

IB Diploma.text: 32 points with 5 points in Mathematics Higher Level (HL) and 5 points in either Chemistry or Physics.

SACE/WACE.text: a TER 70 and Grade B in Mathematics AND Chemistry OR Physics.

programs.program_name: Bachelor of Arts in Chinese Studies (Honours)

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level:
A pass in A-Level with at least a Grade D in any 2 subjects.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Chinese
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: A pass in UEC with at least a Grade B in 5 subjects including Chinese.
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma:
A pass in Diploma with at least CGPA 2.0 out of 4.0.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Chinese
entry_requirements_raw.STPM:
A pass in STPM with at least a Grade C (GP 2.0) in any 2 subjects.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Chinese
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation:
A pass in Foundation/Matriculation with at least CGPA 2.0 out of 4.0.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Chinese

course_content.core: Chinese Language 现代汉语 Introduction to Chinese History 中国文化导论 Introduction to Chinese Philosophy 中国历史导论 History of Chinese Literature Part One: Pre-Qin to Tang and Wudai 中国文学史1：先秦至唐五代 History of Chinese Literature Part Two: Song to Qing Period 中国文学史2：宋元明清 Introduction to Literary Theory 文学概论 Introduction to Linguistics 语言学概论 Classical Chinese 古代汉语 Modern and Contemporary Chinese Literature 中国现当代文学 Research Methods 研究方法论 Thesis 毕业论文

credit in Chinese

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level: Pass A-level with at least Grade D in 2 subjects.  English Language – a credit in SPM level or the equivalent
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: Pass UEC with at least Grade B in 5 subjects including English Language subject.  English Language – a credit in SPM level or the equivalent
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma: Pass Diploma in Media and Communication field or the equivalent with at least CGPA 2.00.  English Language – a credit in SPM level or the equivalent
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Pass STPM or equivalent with minimum Grade C (GP 2.00) in 2 subjects.  English Language – a credit in SPM level or the equivalent
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation: Pass Matriculation/Foundation or the equivalent with at least CGPA 2.00.  English Language – a credit in SPM level or the equivalent

course_content.core: MAJOR CORE Introduction to Mass Communication Introduction to New Media Studies Media Law and Ethics Persuasive Communication Public Speaking Audiovisual Production Principles of Public Relations Media Writing Academic Writing Human Communication Media Content Editing Organizational Communication Social Media and Crisis Communication Event Management Research Methods in Communication Public Relations Counselling Media Literacy and Critical Thinking New Media Marketing Screen Studies Media Management Thesis Writing Industrial Training

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level:
Pass A-level with at least grade D in 2 subjects.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Advanced Mathematics
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: Grade B in 5 Subjects including Advanced Mathematics.
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma: Minimum CGPA 2.00 (Diploma in a related field).
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Principal Passes in Mathematics and 1 Science subject.

Minimum CGPA 2.00.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Advanced Mathematics subject or Mathematics and one Science/ Technology/ Engineering subject

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level:
minimum passes in 2 subjects.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Additional Mathematics
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: at least Grade B in 5 subjects including Advanced Mathematics.
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma:
pass in Diploma in Computer Science/Information System/Information Technology/Software Engineering or equivalent with a minimum CGPA 2.5*, and credit in Additional Mathematics in SPM or equivalent Other Diplomas: a minimum CGPA of 2.5, and credit in Additional Mathematics in SPM or equivalent.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Additional Mathematics
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: minimum Grade C (NGMP 2.00) in 2 subjects, and pass in SPM or equivalent with credit in Additional Mathematics.
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation:
at least CGPA 2.0 in the relevant field.  SPM-level or equivalent:
credit in Additional Mathematics
entry_requirements_raw.CPU: an average of 70% and pass 6 subjects including Mathematics.
entry_requirements_raw.SACE/WACE: a TER 70 and Grade B in 2 relevant subjects including Mathematics.

programs.program_name: Bachelor of Electrical and Electronics Engineering (Hons)

entry_requirements_raw.A-Level: A pass in A-Level with at least a Grade C in Mathematics AND Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: A pass in UEC with at least a Grade B in 5 subjects including Mathematics, Chemistry AND Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.Diploma: A pass in Diploma with at least CGPA 2.5 out of 4.0 AND passes in Mathematics AND Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: A pass in STPM with at least a Grade C (GP 2.0) in Mathematics AND Physics.
entry_requirements_raw.Foundation: A pass in Foundation/Matriculation with at least CGPA 2.0 out of 4.0 AND passes in Mathematics AND Physics.

course_content.core:
Year 1 Semester 1 Engineering Mathematics (I) Programming Language C Electrical Engineering Bahasa Melayu Komunikasi 2 / Tamadun Islam dan Tamadun Asia (TITAS) Bahasa Kebangsaan A / Writing for Professional Purposes Selection from General Electives Semester 2 Engineering Mathematics (II) Electronics Engineering Engineering Physics (I) Circuits and Devices Engineering Graphics Introduction to the Constitution of Malaysia Community Service Semester 3 Malaysian Studies 3 / HubunganEtnik Selection from General Electives  Year 2 Semester 1 Engineering Mathematics (III) Engineering Physics (II) Microelectronic Devices and Circuits Engineers and Society Instrumentation Engineering Elective Choices SPICE Circuit Simulation Introduction to Matlab Programming Artificial Intelligence Programming Practice Data Structures Laboratory on Circuit Analysis Semester 2 Engineering Mathematics (IV) Computer Architecture Digital Electronics Signals and Systems "Semiconductor Physics and Device Processes" Engineering Mathematics (V) Semester 3 Selection from General Electives Year 3 Semester 1 Electromagnetic Field Theory and Waves Electrical Machinery and Drive High Voltage Engineering Engineering Management Control System Engineering Elective Choices Electronic Design and Techniques Fundamentals of Microwave Technology Digital Signal Processing Advanced Analogue Circuit Design Digital System Design MCU Technology and Engineering Data Communication Networks Robotic Systems Semester 2 Embedded Systems RF and Microwave Circuits Capstone Project I Power Electronics Statistical and Numerical Techniques Engineering Elective Choices Digital System Design MCU Technology and Engineering Data Communication Networks Robotic Systems Training on Electronic Design and Techniques A Fundamentals of Microwave Technology Digital Signal Processing Advanced Analogue Circuit Design Semester 3 Industrial Training (Malaysia/Xiamen)  Year 4 Semester 1 Final Year Project I
Power System Analysis
Electrical Energy Utilization
Communication System
Capstone Project II Semester 2 Final Year Project II Engineering Elective Choices Microwave EDA Optoelectronic Technology Antenna and Radio Wave Propagation Laboratory on Advanced Circuit Technique RF and MW Measurements Application Themes: Device and System Design Renewable Energy Semester 3 Selection from General Electives
Capstone Project I
Power Electronics
Statistical and Numerical Techniques Engineering Elective Choices Digital System Design MCU Technology and Engineering Data Communication Networks Robotic Systems Training on Electronic Design and Techniques A Fundamentals of Microwave Technology Digital Signal Processing Advanced Analogue Circuit Design
